speaker: PORTER
text: You’ll leave your noise anon, you rascals! Do

speaker: PORTER
text: you take the court for Parish Garden? You rude

speaker: PORTER
text: slaves, leave your gaping!

speaker: ONE
text: Good Master Porter, I belong to th’

speaker: ONE
text: larder.

speaker: PORTER
text: Belong to th’ gallows and be hanged, you rogue!

speaker: PORTER
text: Is this a place to roar in?—Fetch me a dozen crab-tree

speaker: PORTER
text: staves, and strong ones. These are but switches

speaker: PORTER
text: to ’em.—I’ll scratch your heads! You must be seeing

speaker: PORTER
text: christenings? Do you look for ale and cakes here,

speaker: PORTER
text: you rude rascals?

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
Pray
              ,
               
              sir
              ,
               
              be
               
              patient
              .
               
              ’Tis
               
              as
               
              much
               
              impossible
              —

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
Unless
               
              we
               
              sweep
               
              ’em
               
              from
               
              the
               
              door
               
              with
               
              cannons
              —

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
To
               
              scatter
               
              ’em
               
              as
               
              ’tis
               
              to
               
              make
               
              ’em
               
              sleep

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
On
               
              May
               
              Day
               
              morning
              ,
               
              which
               
              will
               
              never
               
              be
              .

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
We
               
              may
               
              as
               
              well
               
              push
               
              against
               
              Paul’s
               
              as
               
              stir
               
              ’em
              .

speaker: PORTER
text:
How
               
              got
               
              they
               
              in
              ,
               
              and
               
              be
               
              hanged
              ?

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
Alas
              ,
               
              I
               
              know
               
              not
              .
               
              How
               
              gets
               
              the
               
              tide
               
              in
              ?

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
As
               
              much
               
              as
               
              one
               
              sound
               
              cudgel
               
              of
               
              four
               
              foot
              —

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
You
               
              see
               
              the
               
              poor
               
              remainder
              —
              could
               
              distribute
              ,

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
I
               
              made
               
              no
               
              spare
              ,
               
              sir
              .

speaker: PORTER
text:
You
               
              did
               
              nothing
              ,
               
              sir
              .

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
I
               
              am
               
              not
               
              Samson
              ,
               
              nor
               
              Sir
               
              Guy
              ,
               
              nor
               
              Colbrand
              ,

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
To
               
              mow
               
              ’em
               
              down
               
              before
               
              me
              ;
               
              but
               
              if
               
              I
               
              spared
               
              any

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
That
               
              had
               
              a
               
              head
               
              to
               
              hit
              ,
               
              either
               
              young
               
              or
               
              old
              ,

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
He
               
              or
               
              she
              ,
               
              cuckold
               
              or
               
              cuckold-maker
              ,

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
Let
               
              me
               
              ne’er
               
              hope
               
              to
               
              see
               
              a
               
              chine
               
              again
              —

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
And
               
              that
               
              I
               
              would
               
              not
               
              for
               
              a
               
              cow
              ,
               
              God
               
              save
               
              her
              !

speaker: ONE
text: Do you hear, Master Porter?

speaker: PORTER
text: I shall be with you presently, good master

speaker: PORTER
text: puppy.— Keep the door close, sirrah.

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: What would you have me do?

speaker: PORTER
text: What should you do but knock ’em down by

speaker: PORTER
text: th’ dozens? Is this Moorfields to muster in? Or have

speaker: PORTER
text: we some strange Indian with the great tool come to

speaker: PORTER
text: court, the women so besiege us? Bless me, what a

speaker: PORTER
text: fry of fornication is at door! On my Christian conscience,

speaker: PORTER
text: this one christening will beget a thousand;

speaker: PORTER
text: here will be father, godfather, and all together.

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: The spoons will be the bigger, sir. There is

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: a fellow somewhat near the door—he should be a

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: brazier by his face, for, o’ my conscience, twenty of

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: the dog days now reign in ’s nose. All that stand

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: about him are under the line; they need no other

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: penance. That fire-drake did I hit three times on the

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: head, and three times was his nose discharged

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: against me. He stands there like a mortar-piece, to

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: blow us. There was a haberdasher’s wife of small

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: wit near him that railed upon me till her pinked

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: porringer fell off her head for kindling such a

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: combustion in the state. I missed the meteor once

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: and hit that woman, who cried out “Clubs!” when I

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: might see from far some forty truncheoners draw to

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: her succor, which were the hope o’ th’ Strand, where

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: she was quartered. They fell on; I made good my

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: place. At length they came to th’ broomstaff to me;

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: I defied ’em still, when suddenly a file of boys behind

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: ’em, loose shot, delivered such a shower of

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: pibbles that I was fain to draw mine honor in and

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: let ’em win the work. The devil was amongst ’em, I

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text: think, surely.

speaker: PORTER
text: These are the youths that thunder at a playhouse

speaker: PORTER
text: and fight for bitten apples, that no audience

speaker: PORTER
text: but the tribulation of Tower Hill or the limbs of

speaker: PORTER
text: Limehouse, their dear brothers, are able to

speaker: PORTER
text: endure. I have some of ’em in Limbo Patrum, and

speaker: PORTER
text: there they are like to dance these three days, besides

speaker: PORTER
text: the running banquet of two beadles that is to come.

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
Mercy
               
              o’
               
              me
              ,
               
              what
               
              a
               
              multitude
               
              are
               
              here
              !

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
They
               
              grow
               
              still
               
              too
              .
               
              From
               
              all
               
              parts
               
              they
               
              are
               
              coming
              ,

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
As
               
              if
               
              we
               
              kept
               
              a
               
              fair
               
              here
              !
               
              Where
               
              are
               
              these
               
              porters
              ,

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
These
               
              lazy
               
              knaves
              ?
              —
              You’ve
               
              made
               
              a
               
              fine
               
              hand
              ,
               
              fellows
              !

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
There’s
               
              a
               
              trim
               
              rabble
               
              let
               
              in
              .
               
              Are
               
              all
               
              these

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
Your
               
              faithful
               
              friends
               
              o’
               
              th’
               
              suburbs
              ?
               
              We
               
              shall
               
              have

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
Great
               
              store
               
              of
               
              room
              ,
               
              no
               
              doubt
              ,
               
              left
               
              for
               
              the
               
              ladies
              ,

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
When
               
              they
               
              pass
               
              back
               
              from
               
              the
               
              christening
              !

speaker: PORTER
text:
An
               
              ’t
               
              please
               
              your
               
              Honor
              ,

speaker: PORTER
text:
We
               
              are
               
              but
               
              men
              ,
               
              and
               
              what
               
              so
               
              many
               
              may
               
              do
              ,

speaker: PORTER
text:
Not
               
              being
               
              torn
               
              a-pieces
              ,
               
              we
               
              have
               
              done
              .

speaker: PORTER
text:
An
               
              army
               
              cannot
               
              rule
               
              ’em
              .

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
As
               
              I
               
              live
              ,

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
If
               
              the
               
              King
               
              blame
               
              me
               
              for
               
              ’t
              ,
               
              I’ll
               
              lay
               
              you
               
              all

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
By
               
              th’
               
              heels
              ,
               
              and
               
              suddenly
              ,
               
              and
               
              on
               
              your
               
              heads

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
Clap
               
              round
               
              fines
               
              for
               
              neglect
              .
               
              You’re
               
              lazy
               
              knaves
              ,

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
And
               
              here
               
              you
               
              lie
               
              baiting
               
              of
               
              bombards
              ,
               
              when

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
You
               
              should
               
              do
               
              service
              .

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
Hark
              ,
               
              the
               
              trumpets
               
              sound
              !

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
They’re
               
              come
               
              already
               
              from
               
              the
               
              christening
              .

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
Go
               
              break
               
              among
               
              the
               
              press
              ,
               
              and
               
              find
               
              a
               
              way
               
              out

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
To
               
              let
               
              the
               
              troop
               
              pass
               
              fairly
              ,
               
              or
               
              I’ll
               
              find

speaker: CHAMBERLAIN
text:
A
               
              Marshalsea
               
              shall
               
              hold
               
              you
               
              play
               
              these
               
              two
               
              months
              .

speaker: PORTER
text:
Make
               
              way
               
              there
               
              for
               
              the
               
              Princess
              !

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
You
               
              great
               
              fellow
              ,

speaker:
PORTER’S
               
              MAN
text:
Stand
               
              close
               
              up
              ,
               
              or
               
              I’ll
               
              make
               
              your
               
              head
               
              ache
              .

speaker: PORTER
text:
You
               
              i’
               
              th’
               
              camlet
              ,
               
              get
               
              up
               
              o’
               
              th’
               
              rail

speaker: PORTER

I’ll
